\beginhymn Pange lingua gloriosi.

\setgregorian1
\setclef14
\musicindent14mm
\raisesong3\Internote
\nosolesmescustos
\initiumgregorianum
%%%Pange lingua gloriosi
\musicinitial{Hymn\\III.}{P}%
\sgn {}An\punctum L\egn
\sgn ge{}\punctum L\egn
\spatium
\sgn l{i}n\engl{\idx{Sing, my tongue, the Saviour's glory},}\punctum M\egn
\sgn gua\clivis LK\egn
\spatium
\sgn {gl}o{-}\punctum N\egn
\sgn ri{-}\punctum N\egn
\sgn {}{\'o}{-}\pes ac\egn
\sgn si{}\punctum c\augmentum d\egn
\spatium
\divisiominima
\spatium
%\custos c
%\lineaproxima
%%%Corporis mysterium
\sgn C{\'o}r\pes cd\egn
\sgn por\punctum c\egn
\sgn {}is\punctum c\egn
\spatium
\sgn mys\engl{Of His Flesh the mystery sing}\punctum b\egn
\sgn t{\'e}r\punctum a\egn
\sgn {}i{-}\punctum c\egn
\sgn {}u{m,}\climacus baN\augmentum N\egn
\spatium
\divisiominor
\spatium
\custos N
\lineaproxima
%%%Sanguinisque pretiosi,
\sgn San\punctum N\egn
\sgn {gu}in\punctum a\egn
\sgn {}{\'\i}s\punctum c\egn
\sgn {qu}e{}\engl{Of the Blood all price exceeding,}\punctum b\egn
\spatium
\sgn {pr}e{-}\punctum a\egn
\sgn ti{-}\punctum N\egn
\sgn {}{\'o}{-}\punctum a\egn
\sgn si{}\punctum N\augmentum N\egn
\spatium
\divisiominima
\spatium
%\custos a\lineaproxima
%%%Quem in mundi pretium
\sgn {Qu}em\punctum a\egn
\spatium
\sgn {}in\punctum b\egn
\spatium
\sgn m{u}n\engl{Shed by our Immortal King}\punctum N\egn
\sgn di{}\punctum N\egn
\spatium
\sgn {pr}{\'e}{-}\punctum L\egn
\sgn ti{-}\punctum a\egn
\sgn {}u{m}\clivis aK\augmentumduplex bL\egn
\spatium
\divisiominor
\spatium
\custos L
\lineaproxima
%%%Fructus ventris generosi
\sgn {Fr}{u}c\punctum L\egn
\sgn tus\punctum N\egn
\spatium
\sgn v{e}n\engl{Destined for the world's redemption ~}\punctum N\egn
\sgn {tr}is\punctum L\egn
\spatium
%\custos N
%\lineaproxima
\sgn gen\punctum N\egn
\sgn {}er\punctum a\egn
\sgn {}{\'o}{-}\punctum a\egn
\sgn si{}\punctum N\augmentum N\egn
\spatium
\divisiominima
\spatium
%%%Rex effudit gentium
\sgn Rex\punctum a\egn
\spatium
\sgn {}e{ff}\punctum b\egn
\sgn {}{\'u}d\punctum N\egn
\sgn {}it\clivis aN\egn
\spatium
\sgn g{\'e}n\engl{From a noble womb to spring.}\clivis ML\egn
\sgn ti{-}\punctum K\egn
\sgn {}u{m}\punctum L\augmentum L\egn
\spatium
\divisiofinalis
\spatium
%%%Amen
\spatium
\sgn {}Am\torculus LML\egn
\sgn {}e{n.}\pes KL\augmentumduplex LJ\egn
\spatium
\Finisgregoriana

\bigskip

\beginlyrics

\hbox{

\vtop{

\rm%lyrics

\hsize50mm

\verse2. Nobis datus, nobis natus\\
Ex int\'acta V\'\i rgine,\\
Et in mundo convers\'atus\\
Sparso verbi s\'emine,\\
Sui moras incol\'atus\\
Miro clausit \'ordine.

\verse3. In supr\'em{\ae} nocte c\oe n\ae\\
Rec\'umbens cum fr\'atribus,\\
Observ\'ata lege plene\\
Cibis in leg\'alibus,\\
Cibum turb{\ae} duod\'en{\ae}\\
Sedat suis m\'anibus.


\verse4. Verbum caro, panem verum\\
Verbo carnem \'efficit:\\
Fitque sanguis Christi merum\\
Et si sensus d\'eficit,\\
Ad firm\'andum cor sinc\'erum\\
Sola fides s\'ufficit.

}

\hskip5mm
\vtop{
\hsize50mm

\it%lyrics

\verse2. Of a pure and spotless Virgin,\\
Born for us on earth below,\\
He, as Man with man conversing,\\
Stayed, the seeds of truth to sow.\\
Then He closed in solemn order\\
Wondrously His life of woe.


\verse3. On the night of that Last Supper\\
Seated with His chosen band\\
He, the Paschal victim eating,\\
First fulfils the Law's command;\\
Then as food to all His brethren\\
Gives Himself with His own Hand.


\verse4. Word made Flesh, the bread of nature;\\
By His Word to Flesh He turns;\\
Wine into His Blood He changes: \\
What though sense no change discerns?\\
Only be the heart in earnest,\\
Faith her lesson quickly learns.



}
}

\medskip


\bigskip
\goodbreak
%\filbreak



\hbox{



\vtop{
\hsize50mm

\rm%lyrics

\verse5. {\smallcaps Tantum ergo Sacram\'entum}\\
Vener\'emur c\'ernui:\\
Et ant\'\i quum docum\'entum\\
Novo cedat r\'\i tui\\
Pr\ae stet fides supplem\'entum\\
S\'ensuum def\'ectui.

\verse6. Genit\'ori Genit\'oque\\
Laus et jubil\'atio,\\
Salus, honor, virtus quoque\\
Sit et bened\'\i ctio:\\
Proced\'enti ab utr\'oque\\
Compar sit laud\'atio.

Amen.

}


\hskip5mm

\vtop{
\hsize50mm

\it%lyrics

\verse5. {\smallcaps Down in adoration falling,}\\
This great Sacrament we hail,\\
Ancient types have long departed\\
Newer rites of grace prevail\\
Faith for all defects supplying\\
Where the feeble senses fail.

\verse6. Glory let us give and blessing\\
To the Father and the Son\\
Honour might and praise addressing\\
While eternal ages run \\
Equal praise to Him confessing\\
Who proceeds from both as one.

Amen.

}
}

\endlyrics

\bigskip

%\centerline{Amen.}

\source St.~Thomas Aquinas, {\smold 1227}--{\smold 74}

\source Translated by Fr.~E.~Caswall {\smold 1814}--\smold 78

%\bigskip

%\input glorybetojesus

%\endhymn
